reasoning: The critique mostly restates (and slightly oversimplifies) a key dialectical point from the essay’s own section 2.4 rather than providing an objection to the essay’s overall position. Even if granted, it mainly targets optimism about widespread accurate motivational convergence (WAM), which the essay itself already argues is unlikely and is not the core basis for its residual optimism (which comes largely from partial convergence plus trade/compromise). As written it provides no supporting argument, so it barely weakens anything. It is fairly clear, but only partly correct: the essay does not claim moral realism *implies* convergence without motivation; it argues motivation is uncertain and may fail even if convergence occurs.
title: Moral antirealism blocks convergence while realism provides it without practical motivation
